column4: My vsftpd is not working. I can't connect to it externally...
I'm suspecting my /etc/hosts is configured badly?
can you telnet to the socket from another PC? Can clients ping the server
I can connect to it internally
so only outside your LAN is the issue?
i have forwarded ports on my router just fine. The vsftpd just responds with an unroutable address for external clients
correct
thought about using sftp instead, it is default enabled with openssh-server and is secure
Yes, I am aware. I personally use winscp to connect trough ssh. But my noob friends need to use FTP
Any idea about my ftp problem?
Server sent passive reply with unroutable address. Using server address instead.
try:  ftp -vv user@server    from external, see what happens, also check ftp logs
this message "Server sent passive reply with unroutable address. Using server address instead.
how much free space do your partitions have?
more than enough i'd say
run:  df -h
114 gb avi
do you have a separate patition for /home ?
i dont think so
i've not used encryptfs, maybe others can help

in my last session i accidentally removed gnome-panel.. then switched to ubuntu 2d and in that session i reinstalled gnome-panel because i lost my unity @ login prompt. from there reinstalled gnome-panel and fiddled with nvidia display settings which made both my screens black
